result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard O. Knapp

records.addlTxt: Order Denying defendant's motion to modify bond.

Defendant Richard O. Knapp not in court.  Attorney Nathan J. Heim appeared by video for Richard O. Knapp.  Attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Heim informs the Court that the defendant could not appear today as he is recovering from surgery and is on a ventilator.  
Court denies the bond motion for reasons stated on the record.  
Re the payors request for the cash bail posted to be returned to him, the Court denies that request at this time as it is not a bail modification issue and Atty Heim may re-file that request under different grounds.  
Cash bail forfeiture is stopped - bail is reinstated.
Letter from ADA Feest to Judge Rohrer.
Bail/bond hearing on November 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

-Defendant Richard O. Knapp in court.  Attorney Carl W Knepel in court for Richard O. Knapp.  Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives time limits in which a preliminary hearing must be held.
Preliminary hearing set for 12-19-2022 at 08:30am
Attorney Heim, Public Defender
Adjourned initial appearance on October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
THE WARRANT has been cancelled and a new initial appearance reset to 10/17/2022 at 1:30 p.m.  FAILURE TO APPEAR WILL RESULT IN A WARRANT BEING ISSUED.
Not mailed. Warrant Canceled.

2:14 PM Defendant Richard O. Knapp not in court.  Special appearance by Attorney Heather M Faeh in court for Richard O. Knapp.  Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
The defendant fails to appear for today's initial appearance. State requests a warrant.
The Court authorizes a warrant for the defendant and orders forfeiture of cash bail.

$4,000.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.

Victim Identification Key.
RE:  Stalking, between 04-24-22 and 09-20-22.
Prints ordered (MTSO)
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 09-21-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of stalking, violate restraining order and felony bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 09-26-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $4,000.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with N.M., DOB: 09-21-1999, any premises she may occupy or the residence of 563 S. Main Street #7, Mishicot, WI and defendant must remain at least 500 feet from the victim's residence and the victim.    Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
